com.bigdata.io

Interface IManagedByteArray

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IByteArraySlice
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IByteArrayBuffer, IKeyBuilder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteArrayBuffer, DataOutputBuffer, KeyBuilder

    public interface IManagedByteArray
extends IByteArraySlice
    An interface for a managed byte[]. Implementations of this interface may permit transparent extension of the managed byte[].
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IManagedByteArray append(byte b)
      Append a byte into the managed byte[].
      IManagedByteArray append(byte[] a)
      Append data into the managed byte[].
      IManagedByteArray append(byte[] a, int off, int len)
      Append data into the managed byte[].
      int capacity()
      Return the capacity of the backing buffer.
      void ensureCapacity(int capacity)
      Ensure that the buffer capacity is a least capacity total bytes.
      void ensureFree(int len)
      Ensure that at least len bytes are free in the buffer.
      IManagedByteArray reset()
      Reset the buffer length to zero.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.bigdata.io.IByteArraySlice

        array, len, off, toByteArray

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        IManagedByteArray reset()
        Reset the buffer length to zero.
        Returns:
        this.

      • append

        IManagedByteArray append(byte b)
        Append a byte into the managed byte[]. The backing buffer will be automatically extended if necessary.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte.

      • append

        IManagedByteArray append(byte[] a)
        Append data into the managed byte[]. The backing buffer will be automatically extended if necessary.
        Parameters:
        a - The source data.

      • append

        IManagedByteArray append(byte[] a,
                       int off,
                       int len)
        Append data into the managed byte[]. The backing buffer will be automatically extended if necessary.
        Parameters:
        a - The source data.
        off - The offset of the first byte to be copied.
        len - The #of bytes to be copied.

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Return the capacity of the backing buffer.

      • ensureFree

        void ensureFree(int len)
        Ensure that at least len bytes are free in the buffer. The buffer may be grown by this operation but it will not be truncated.

        This operation is equivalent to 

         ensureCapacity(len() + len)
        and the latter is often used as an optimization.
        Parameters:
        len - The minimum #of free bytes.

      • ensureCapacity

        void ensureCapacity(int capacity)
        Ensure that the buffer capacity is a least capacity total bytes. The buffer may be grown by this operation but it will not be truncated.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The minimum #of bytes in the buffer.
